docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (Reuters) The Senate completed Congressional action today on a $6.7 billion foreign-aid bill containing prohibitions on military and economic aid to various countries in Asia, Africa and Latin America. The measure was sent to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 19 (Reuters) The Senate completed Congressional action today on a $6.7 billion foreign-aid bill containing prohibitions on military and economic aid to various countries in Asia, Africa and Latin America. The measure was sent to the White House for signature.
docs.abstract: Sen completes action on $6.7-million foreign-aid bill that includes prohibitions on min and econ aid to Cambodia (S)

headline.main: Senate Sends Foreign-Aid Bill, With Curbs, to the White House

docs.snippet: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Oct. 21 (UPI) The Inter-American Press Association warned today that virulent hostility toward press freedom had led to the elimination of restriction of that freedom in more than half of the 30 Western Hemisphere...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic, Oct. 21 (UPI) The Inter-American Press Association warned today that virulent hostility toward press freedom had led to the elimination of restriction of that freedom in more than half of the 30 Western Hemisphere territories.
docs.abstract: Inter-Amer Press Assn warns that virulent hostility toward press freedom has led to elimination of restriction of freedom in more than half of 30 Western Hemisphere territories; status of press freedom in individual nations listed (S)

headline.main: WIDE PRESS CURBS FOUND IN WESTERN HEMISPHERE

docs.snippet: LONDON--Is there an international organization that coordinates hijacking and other acts of terrorism? Is the whole thing run by some warped mastermind out of a secret headquarters?
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON--Is there an international organization that coordinates hijacking and other acts of terrorism? Is the whole thing run by some warped mastermind out of a secret headquarters?
docs.abstract: recent hijackings and kidnappings raise question of whether such acts are coordinated by internatl orgn; Brit and Continental experts believe loose and shifting alliance exists; Dr Richard Clutterbuck says drive toward centralization may be coming from former leaders of Revolutionary Coordinating Junta; London Times says junta has set up hq in Paris, and has become clearinghouse for internatl terrorism; cartoon (M)

headline.main: A Loose Alliance of Terrorists Does Seem to Exist

docs.snippet: Videotapes, identification photographs and other evidence relating to a possible ringer case last month at Belmont Park were impounded yesterday by the New York Racing Association.
docs.lead_paragraph: Videotapes, identification photographs and other evidence relating to a possible ringer case last month at Belmont Park were impounded yesterday by the New York Racing Association.
docs.abstract: NYS Racing and Wagering Bd impounds evidence; illus (M)

headline.main: Racing Inquiry Impounds Data In Belmont Horse-Identity Case; Cinzano Reportedly Destroyed N.Y.R.A. Impounds Data in Belmont Inquiry

docs.snippet: Solid evidence replaced rumor and supposition yesterday in Belmont Park's ringer case when investigators confirmed that the long-shot winner of a race there last month was not the horse the public believed him to be.
docs.lead_paragraph: Solid evidence replaced rumor and supposition yesterday in Belmont Park's ringer case when investigators confirmed that the long-shot winner of a race there last month was not the horse the public believed him to be.
docs.abstract: NYS Racing and Wagering Bd says winner was not Lebon; suspends horse's owner and trainer Jack Morgan and veterinarian Dr Mark Gerard pending outcome of hearing; turns case over to Nassau County Dist Atty's office; Jockey Club of Uruguay sends identification photographs and other evidence indicating that Lebon is really Cinzano, much faster horse that supposedly died on Gerard's LI farm; Joseph Taub is Cinzano's Amer owner (M)

headline.main: 2 Men Are Suspended In Racing 'Ringer' Case; Two Suspended in 'Ringer' Case

docs.snippet: A three-inch scar on the shoulder of the mystery horse in Belmont Park's ringer case emerged yesterday as a major clue to the puzzle.
docs.lead_paragraph: A three-inch scar on the shoulder of the mystery horse in Belmont Park's ringer case emerged yesterday as a major clue to the puzzle.
docs.abstract: informed sources say scar on shoulder indicates that horse is Cinzano (M)

headline.main: Scar Is Prime Clue in 'Ringer' Mystery; Scar Called Top Clue In the 'Ringer' Mystery

docs.snippet: New York racing's so-called "ringer mystery" moved into the courts yesterday when Dr. Mark Gerard obtained a restraining order that stays his suspension at least temporarily.
docs.lead_paragraph: New York racing's so-called "ringer mystery" moved into the courts yesterday when Dr. Mark Gerard obtained a restraining order that stays his suspension at least temporarily.

headline.main: Court Stays Racing Suspension Of Veterinarian in 'Ringer' Case

docs.snippet: While legal maneuvering intensified yesterday in the Belmont Park ringer case, investigators were leaning to the theory that both horses in the suspected switch were still alive.
docs.lead_paragraph: While legal maneuvering intensified yesterday in the Belmont Park ringer case, investigators were leaning to the theory that both horses in the suspected switch were still alive.
docs.abstract: NYS Sup Ct Appellate Div Justice Vito Titone reverses Gerard's stay; investigators say both horses suspected in switch may still be alive; Gerard por (M)

headline.main: Tie Great Horse Racing Mystery; Gerard Is Suspended Anew Gerard Is Suspended Once Again as an Appellate Justice Vacates Stay

docs.snippet: Businessmen in the major industrial nations of Western Europe and Latin America have altered their living and working patterns in the wake of extortion, kidnapping and murder by terrorists.
docs.lead_paragraph: Businessmen in the major industrial nations of Western Europe and Latin America have altered their living and working patterns in the wake of extortion, kidnapping and murder by terrorists.
docs.abstract: Survey of NY Times correspondents in W Ger, Italy, Argentina, Brit, France and US shows terrorist activities have altered living patterns and working patterns of businessmen in major indus nations of W Eur and Latin Amer, but most businesses continue to function normally, and natl economies hove not been affected; illus (L)

headline.main: Terrorism Is Changing Executives' Lives; Terrorism Forcing Sharp Changes In the Lives of Many Businessmen

docs.snippet: Columbo would have loved it. The diminutive television detective would have solved the Great Horse Racing Mystery within 90 minutes, less time for commercials, and moved on to his next assignment, mangy raincoat and all.
